context: The Estonian word 'kompanii' has three main meanings: 1) A business enterprise or commercial company in various economic sectors like industry and trade; 2) A military unit consisting of several groups (100-250 soldiers) in infantry and armored forces; 3) A group, party, or crowd of people. The word is often used as a component in compound words to specify types of companies (e.g., 'aktsiakompanii' - joint-stock company, 'lennukompanii' - airline).
